What would be the best way to approach this?

The given code uses the StringTokenizer class to split the CurrentString into tokens based on the delimiter ":". The split() method of the String class takes a string as an argument and returns an array of substrings. In this case, we want to split the CurrentString into two tokens, so we use the colon ":" as the delimiter. The split() method returns an array of substrings, where each substring is a token. We then use the StringTokenizer class to extract the first and second tokens from the array. Finally, we use the SetText() method of two different TextViews to display the extracted tokens.
